thread.title: ALL-DISTRICT FOOTBALL: Jammer, Cam Brown earn top honors
thread.title_full: ALL-DISTRICT FOOTBALL: Jammer, Cam Brown earn top honors

author: From Facts staff reports
title: ALL-DISTRICT FOOTBALL: Jammer, Cam Brown earn top honors
text:
The Angleton Wildcats had an historic football season.
The Wildcats finished second in District 11-5A, Division 1 with a 6-1 record in league play and a 13-2 overall mark. The 2024 squad was the first Angleton team since 2017 to advance to the state semifinal round of the UIL playoffs.
To get there, Angleton defeated Pflugerville Weiss in the bidistrict round, Port Arthur Memorial in Round 2, College Station in a regional semifinal and fellow District 11 foe La Porte in the regional championship. The Wildcats lost to eventual Class 5A, Division 1 state champion Smithson Valley in the state semifinal game in Waco.
La Porte (7-0, 10-4) won the district, followed by Angleton, Crosby (5-2, 5-6) and Friendswood (4-3, 5-6).
The successful season led to many all-district selections for the Wildcats, including a pair of superlative honors.
Kasen Jammer was named defensive newcomer of the year and Camdyn Brown earned co-defensive lineman of the year honors.
Other top recognition included Crosby running back Wesley Yarbrough as the district’s most valuable player, linebacker Copelin Windfont as the defensive MVP and nose guard Jeffery Curette as the co-defensive lineman of the year; La Porte running back Tyresse Barnes as the offensive MVP, lineman Jake Hayman as offensive lineman of the year, running back Sean Simon as the offensive newcomer of the year and head coach Kevin Berneathy and staff as the coaching staff of the year; and Kingwood Park’s Kallen Cosper as the special teams player of the year.
First-team offensive selections for Angleton included Bryce Duron, quarterback, Jamarcus Shockley, running back, Elijah Bradford, lineman, Charles Jones, lineman, and Ivan Rodriguez, kicker.
Other first-team selections included Kingwood Park’s Aaron Gilliam, quarterback, Kye Wehby, receiver, and Dakoda Dement, guard; La Porte’s Ricky Sandolph, running back, Ryker Reynolds, tight end, and Kylin Manning, lineman; Friendswood’s Garrett Muecke, receiver; Crosby’s Nicholas Samuel, receiver, and Nathan O’Flaherty, tackle; and Porter’s Hector Flores, guard.
First-team defensive selections for Angleton included Kaden Edwards, linebacker, Raydin Garcia, linebacker, Maurice Hightower, cornerback, and Ryland Brown, safety.
Other first-team defenders included La Porte’s Luke Mora, lineman, Ashton Ruffin, linebacker, and Blake Stout, safety; Kingwood Park’s Tristan Viso, defensive end, Ethan Elliott, linebacker, Alex Hartnett, punter; Friendswood’s Jacob Molina, Caleb Allen, inside linebacker, and Nicholas Ruffeno, safety; and Crosby’s Keenan Bradley, defensive end, Cameron Grandmaiter, cornerback, Josiah Jones, free safety, and Joshua Jackson, utility.
Second-team offensive selections for Angleton included Nicholas Jackson, receiver, J’Shun Sanders, receiver, and Gavin Hebert, lineman.
Other second-team offensive players included Porter’s Stone Singletary, quarterback; La Porte’s Alijah Bright, running back, Francisco Guzman, lineman, Landon Guzman, center, Oswaldo Lopez, kicker; Friendswood’s Walker Winters, running back, Jaxson Lee, receiver, and Tyler Threadgill, tackle; Kingwood Park’s Elliott, tight end, and Gavin Lynch, tackle; and Crosby’s Jackson, receiver, and Aanson Johnson, guard.
Safety Trae’Vonne Latimer was Angleton’s lone second-team defensive selection.
Other second-team defense included La Porte’s David Campos, lineman, Tayton Self, lineman, Caden Watson, linebacker, Malik King-Miller, cornerback, Shauncey Regis, safety, and Trent Callies, utility; Porter’s Dominic Mottley, nose tackle, and Jalen Richard, cornerback; Pasadena’s Antonio Conchas, defensive tackle, and Adam Sachez, linebacker; Friendswood’s Jordyn Crites, defensive end, and Mason Sindelar, outside linebacker; Kingwood Park’s Major Dalby, linebacker; Crosby’s Daniel Willis, punter.
Honorable mention players for Angleton included Wesley Jackson, receiver, Zechariah Jammer, running back, Travon Waddy, running back, Wyatt Neyland, tight end/running back, Noah Ernst, lineman, Jackson Garrett, lineman, Bradley Walker, lineman, Brynden Mack, defensive lineman, Sergio Jackson, lineman, Melvon Cordy-Perry, lineman, Kamerion Nash, lineman, Christopher Porter, lineman, Landon Miles, safety, and Cody Norman, deep snapper.
Academic all-district student-athletes for Angleton included Mauricio Alfaro, John Arias, Bradford, Camdyn Brown, Rylandn Brown, Jayden Bryant, Miller Cade, Zane Dietz, Duron, Kaden Edwards, Michael Edwards, Ernst, Trey Gardner, Nevan Goins, Hebert, Hightower, Nicholas Jackson, Jammer, Jones, Erick Lanzas, Neyland, Coby Norman, Isaiah Robinson, Ivan Rodriguez, Nicholas Rodriguez, Sanders, Traylon Shelton, Shockley, Ethan Snow, Anthony Thomas and Bradly Walker.
Academic all-state went to Norman, Kaden Edwards, Snow, Camdyn Brown, Ryland Brown, Goins, Dietz, Ivan Rodriguez and Thomas.
